newsitem.title: USA: Endovascular Tech sees Q2 revs below Q1.
newsitem.headline: Endovascular Tech sees Q2 revs below Q1.

text.p: EndoVascular Technologies Inc on Wednesday said it expects revenues in its second quarter to fall below the first quarter's $843,125.
In a statement, the company said its first quarter sales were primarily driven by a backlog of patients who entered U.S. trials of the company's products at the end of 1996.
"With this backlog cleared, we would expect that second quarter product sales will not exceed first quarter levels," Brad Cole, chief financial officer, said in a statement.
The comany develops minimally invasive endovascular systems to repair diseased or damaged vascular structures.

Earlier it reported a first quarter net loss of $4.6 million, or $0.54 a share, versus a net loss of $2.7 million, or $0.35 a share, one year ago. In the first quarter of 1996, revenues were $103,000.
The company said losses in losses in both quarters were primarily due to research and development spending, which includes the costs of clinical trials.
